race_hooks.punchy: Champagne gravel at 7,000 feet. 100 miles of Colorado mountain roads where the smooth surface lures you into burning matches the altitude won't forgive.
race_hooks.detail: SBT GRVL's deceptively fast surfaces let you overcook the first half while altitude and relentless rolling terrain compound every pacing mistake. By mile 80, that silky gravel feels like wet cement.

altitude_preparation.why: Race is at 6,700-9,000 ft. Expect 3-8% power loss without preparation.

climbing_fitness.requirement: Sustained climbing ability at altitude power
climbing_fitness.why: Multiple long climbs above 7,000 ft. You must be comfortable climbing at reduced power.

dress_rehearsal.requirement: Complete a race-simulation long ride at target intensity
dress_rehearsal.why: Validates fitness, fueling, and pacing strategy for race distance.

altitude_training.note: Race is at 6,700-9,000 ft. Expect 3-8% power loss. Include altitude simulation if possible.

heat_training.note: Mountain climate - heat is not primary concern, but prepare for sun exposure at altitude.

bonking.action: Stop at next aid station. Eat 200+ calories solid food. Walk for 10 min. Resume at Zone 2 only.

altitude_sickness.action: Reduce effort to Zone 1-2. Focus on breathing rhythm. If headache worsens, stop and descend.

mechanical.action: Move off course. Fix flat calmly. Check tire pressure for altitude (may need adjustment from sea level).

thunderstorm.action: If lightning: get low, off ridgeline. Do not shelter under lone trees. Wait it out - safety over finish time.
